This ideology was pivotal in the party's resurgence, leading to their landslide victory in the 1997 general election, which made Blair the youngest British Prime Minister in over a century.

On the international stage, Blair presided over the British involvement in the 2003 Iraq War, which was based on the belief that Saddam Hussein possessed weapons of mass destruction. Blair's support for the United States during the Iraq War and the subsequent War on Terror established him as a close ally of US President George W.
